bibl.title: Letter from John G. Walker to John J. Moran, July 19, 1904

div1.p: Walker relates the terms of Moran's appointment to the sanitary staff of the Panama Canal Zone.

div1.head: Letter from John G. Walker to John J. Moran, July 19, 1904
div1.opener:
ISTHMIAN CANAL COMMISSION.
Rear Admiral JOHN C. WALTER,
United States Navy, Chairman.
Major General GEORGE W. DAVIS,
United States Army.
WILLIAM BARCLAY PARSONS, C. E.
WILLIAM H. BURR, C. E.
BENJAMIN M. HARROD, C. E.
C. EWALD GRUNSKY, C. E.
MR. FRANK J. HECKER.
Ancon, Isthmian Canal Zone,
July 19, 1904.
Mr. John J. Moran,
31 Nassau Street, New York City, N. Y.
Sir:-
div1.p:
You are hereby appointed upon the Sanitary Staff of this Com-
mission for service on the Isthmus of Panama, at a compensation of
$100 per month, beginning on the 19th day of July, 1904, on which
day you will sail on the Panama Railroad Company's steamer leaving
foot of W. 27th Street, New York, for Colon. Upon your arrival on
the Isthmus you will report for duty to Maj.-Gen. Geo. W. Davis,
Governor of the Canal Zone.

In addition to the compensation named above you will be furn-
ished transportation from New York to Colon by the Commission.

A blank Oath of Office can be obtained at the Administration
Building, Ancon, which you will execute as soon as practicable.

The duties of all employees of the Commission are to be such
as may be determined from time to time by the Commission or its au-
thorized representatives.
The service rendered must be satisfactory to the Commission.

Upon the termination of your employment by action of the Com-
mission, after satisfactory service, you will be entitled to free
transportation to New York.

In case of bad conduct resulting in dismissal from the service
of the Commission, no return expenses to the United States will be
allowed.

In case of illness, you will receive medical attendance and
care at one of the hospitals on the Isthmus belonging to the Commis-
sion.

You will be granted (at the convenience of the Commission) six
weeks' leave of absence on full pay during each year of service, and
will receive transportation between Colon and New York on a Panama
Railroad Company's steamer upon the payment of $25 each way, this
being intended to cover cost of food only.

Members of your immediate family will, upon request, be given
passage from New York to Colon at $25 each, and will be given the
same return rate. No charge will be made for children under six
years, and half rates will be charged for children over six and un-
der twelve years of age.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, J.C. Walter
Chairman of Commission.
